data_findings.finding: Problem is 2D bin packing: pack Christmas tree-shaped polygons into smallest square bounding box for n=1 to 200 trees. Score = sum(s²/n) where s is side length. Lower is better. Target: 68.922808

bbox3.cpp is the key optimizer: C++ code using complex number vector coordination, fluid dynamics, hinge pivot, density gradient flow, global boundary tension. Uses OpenMP parallelization. Key params: -n (iterations) -r (radius). Compiled binary runs optimization.

fix_direction technique: Optimizes rotation of entire tree configuration to minimize bounding box. Uses scipy.optimize.minimize_scalar with convex hull points. Can improve score by finding optimal rotation angle (0-90 degrees).

Multi-phase optimization strategy: Phase A (short 2min runs, many n/r combos), Phase B (10min on top candidates), Phase C (20min on best few). Always validate for overlaps and repair by replacing with donor solution.
